args: In a squalid, deserted back alley,\na man vanishes through a hidden door.
Meanwhile, Curran and Heinwald watch\nhis progress with extreme interest.
Now we merely need their leader.\nI imagine he will arrive last;\nhe's a clever one, and no mistake.
That's why it's taken us so long\nto get a lead on this lot.
But we've finally got them cornered—\nthis is the day we catch these scumbags!
The Church has certainly been thorough\nin its pursuit of these people.
But I should expect no less, seeing as\nthey are a group of anti-dragon heretics.
You don't know the half of it—they've been\nattacking dragons everywhere!
It's gotten so bad, the dragons have\nstarted lashing out at nearby villages.
That is likely the group's primary goal.
They seek to paint a picture of dragons\nas harmful, dangerous creatures.
Is all of this why you chose not to summon\n{player_name}?
Pretty much. If he knew about this,\nI couldn't stop him from helping.
But he's got bigger fish to fry.
We can handle lowlifes like this ourselves.
After all, if you spend your whole life\nlooking down, you never see the spars!
Well, while we wait for our man, perhaps\nwe can pass the time with conversation.\nTell me, what is the Goddess to you?
I appreciate that you're bored, Heinwald,\nbut I have no idea what that means.
Exactly what is the nature of this deity\nyour Church worships?
And if she really exists, why does she not\nhandle heretics such as this herself?
That's a pretty lame question, but hey,\nI'll bite.
The Goddess doesn't have time to deal\nwith every worthless lump in this world.
She miraculously saved the world from a\ngreat evil, and we all owe her our thanks.
Now she protects the entire world,\nwhich means she doesn't have the time\nto go after penny-ante chumps like this.
I suppose her adherents would believe\nthat she saved the world.
And yet, I find the argument of the heretics\nwe're pursuing equally interesting.
They claim dragons founded the Church\nso they might position themselves as\nsupreme beings.
To achieve this goal, they needed a figure\nto capture people's hearts and rally them\naround this new religion.
That figure is the Goddess—which means\nyour Church is merely a cog in a scheme\nof world domination hatched by dragons.
You've got real guts to be saying that\nin front of an inquisitor.
If I heard that from anyone else,\nI'd introduce my axe to their face.
You may stay your righteous killing hand;\nI do not believe this theory.
O, Goddess! Bring your smiting judgment\ndown upon this shameless non-believer!
...Besides, if that crazy theory was true,\ndragons would be ruling over us right now.\nBut they DON'T, so it ISN'T.
It seems nothing I say can chip away\nat the rock that is your faith.
Nope. After all, I only became an inquisitor\nto show the Goddess's power to the world.
Still, if I was to play devil's advocate\nfor a moment...
Let's pretend for a second that the\nGoddess doesn't exist.
That doesn't change the fact that the\nChurch—and all those who serve it—\nare continuing to help people.
We don't need her to do anything else;\nthe world is already filled with her love.
The Church will continue to uphold her\nteachings and help those in need.
And that is truly all the proof you\nrequire for her existence?
Right. Even so, there's no end of folks\nwho turn their backs on the goddess's\nsalvation and think only of themselves.
So it's my job to send those fools\nto her with my own two hands.
That's why I'm proud to be an inquisitor\nof the Church. That's all the truth I need.
An answer befitting you indeed.\n...Ah, look there.
I believe our missing man has arrived.

Which is good, because I'm tired of your
absurd questions. No amount of sophistry
is going to bring the Goddess' judgment
down on these freaks!
Then—dare I ask—how exactly does one\n＂bring justice down upon them＂?
How else? With your FIST! Anyone who\nopposes the goddess has to deal with me!
C'mon, partner! Join the Goddess at\nmy side and let's do this thing!
